data.Sentence_cn: 课文24  美
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 24 Beauty

data.Sentence_cn: 在大自然或艺术中瞥见美，常常会给人的心灵带来什么启示?
data.Sentence: What do glimpses of beauty, either in nature or art, often suggest to the human mind?

data.Sentence_cn: 一个年轻人看到日落，
data.Sentence: A young man sees a sunset and,

data.Sentence_cn: 由于无法理解和表达日落在他心中唤起的激情，
data.Sentence: unable to understand or to express the emotion that it rouses in him,

data.Sentence_cn: 便得出结论：日落处想必是通往遥远世界的大门。
data.Sentence: concludes that it must be the gateway to a world that lies beyond

data.Sentence_cn: 无论是谁，在强烈感受到美的时刻，
data.Sentence: It is difficult for any of us in moments of intense aesthetic experience

data.Sentence_cn: 心中都不禁油生一种遐想：
data.Sentence: to resist the suggestion that we are catching a glimpse of a light

data.Sentence_cn: 我们似乎瞥见从另一个世界射向我们的一线光芒，那个世界不仅不同于我们这个世界，
data.Sentence: that shines down to us from a different realm of existence, different and,

data.Sentence_cn: 而且由于美感的强烈感染，在某些方面比我们这个世界更美好。
data.Sentence: because the experience is intensely moving, in some way higher.

data.Sentence_cn: 虽然这光芒令人眼花缭乱，但它确实给予我们一种美感和静谧的启示。
data.Sentence: And, though the gleams blind and dazzle, yet do they convey a hint of beauty and serenity

data.Sentence_cn: 这是我们不曾经历和无法想象的。这种美感和静谧是我们无法描述的，
data.Sentence: greater than we have known or imagined. Greater too than we can describe;

data.Sentence_cn: 因为我们发明的语言是用来描述这个世界的含义，
data.Sentence: for language, which was invented to convey the meanings of this world

data.Sentence_cn: 不能随便拿来去描述另一个世界。
data.Sentence: cannot readily be fitted to the uses of another.

data.Sentence_cn: 不可否认，一切伟大的艺术都具有使人遐想到进入天外世界的魅力。
data.Sentence: That all great art has this power of suggesting a world beyond is undeniable.

data.Sentence_cn: 在某种状态下，大自然也有这种魅力。
data.Sentence: In some moods, nature shares it.

data.Sentence_cn: 六月蔚蓝的天空总使人遥想一个更加蔚蓝的苍穹；
data.Sentence: There is no sky in June so blue that it does not point forward to a bluer,

data.Sentence_cn: 美丽的落日总会引起一个更加绚丽的景象
data.Sentence: no sunset so beautiful that it does not waken the vision of a greater beauty,

data.Sentence_cn: 未及饱览便一闪即逝，
data.Sentence: a vision which passes before it is fully glimpsed,

data.Sentence_cn: 并在消逝中给人留下不可名状的渴望和惆怅。
data.Sentence: and in passing leaves an indefinable longing and regret.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果这个世界不只是一个拙劣的恶作剧，
data.Sentence: But, if this world is not merely a bad joke,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果人生不只是群星寒光中平凡的一闪，
data.Sentence: life a vulgar flare amid the cool radiance of the stars,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果存在不只是对神秘事物的一种空虚的笑声，
data.Sentence: and existence an empty laugh braying across the mysteries;

data.Sentence_cn: 如果某种玄妙事物的暗示
data.Sentence: if these intimations of a something behind and beyond

data.Sentence_cn: 不是消化不良引起的邪恶情绪，
data.Sentence: are not evil humour born of indigestion,

data.Sentence_cn: 也不是魔鬼为了捉弄我们，使我们发狂而送给我们的邪念，一句话，
data.Sentence: or whimsies sent by the devil to mock and madden us, if, in a word

data.Sentence_cn: 如果美有某种意义的话，我闪千万不要去阐明它的意义。
data.Sentence: beauty means something yet we must not seek to interpret the meaning.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果我瞥见了只可意会不可言传的事物，企图把它说出来，那上不明智的；
data.Sentence: If we glimpse the unutterable, it is unwise to try to utter it,

data.Sentence_cn: 对于我们不理解的事物，我们也不应该去赋予它某种意义。
data.Sentence: nor should we seek to invest with significance that which we cannot grasp.

data.Sentence_cn: 用对我们人类有意义的词解释美是没有意义的。
data.Sentence: Beauty in terms of our human meanings is meaningless.
